text: Shapur II ( , 309–379), also known as Shapur the Great, was the tenth Sasanian King of Kings (Shahanshah) of Iran. He took the title at birth and held it until his death at age 70, making him the longest-reigning monarch in Iranian history. He was the son of Hormizd II (r. 302–309). ==References and notes== Category:Shahs of Iran Category:309 births Category:379 deaths
title: Shapur II
